H0.text: 1 is the number of oak trees the scientist should use to obtain the most reliable data when studying the effect of acid rain.

H1.text: 2 is the number of oak trees the scientist should use to obtain the most reliable data when studying the effect of acid rain on oak trees.

H2.text: 20 oak trees is the number the scientist should use to obtain the most reliable data when studying the effect of acid rain on oak trees.

H3.text: 200 oak trees are the number the scientist should use to obtain the most reliable data while studying the effect of acid rain on oak trees.

A4.text: It is preferable to examine a sample of 200 fish rather than 100 fish.

A5.text: Larger sample sizes generally lead to increased precision when estimating unknown parameters.
